title: Motor neurone disease: Intense exercise increases risk, say scientists
description: Regular and strenuous exercise can increase the risk of MND in people who are vulnerable, scientists say.

title: Coronavirus: Can countries pay back pandemic debt?
description: Countries around the world have borrowed staggering amounts to deal with the pandemic. But where does a government borrow that money from - and can it ever be paid back?

title: What is Trooping the Colour?

title: Why it's the end of the road for petrol stations
description: Many petrol stations will close over the next 20 years, accelerating the shift to electric cars.

title: Where have all the UK workers gone?

title: The Beast: How Biden's getting around on his first overseas trip
description: Planes, helicopters and armoured cars - how President Biden will travel on his first official trip.

title: Why some say this Nevada town siren is a racist relic
description: The siren has been called a "piece of historical trauma" over its disputed link to sundown towns.

title: Maya Forstater: Woman wins tribunal appeal over transgender tweets

title: Girls asked for nudes by up to 11 boys a night, Ofsted finds
description: Sexual harassment is being "normalised" among school-age children, England's schools watchdog finds.

title: In pictures: Solar eclipse as seen from the UK
description: Some parts of the world have seen the annular eclipse, but from the UK there has been a partial solar eclipse.

title: Ex-Brewdog staff allege 'culture of fear' at brewer

description: The Health Secretary has been answering questions about his handling of the Covid-19 pandemic.

description: Bolton had been "ground zero" for the new variant, but now cases have started to fall.

title: Covid: Birmingham NHS worker stole dead patient's bank card to buy snacks

description: But number of people waiting over a year drops for first time since pandemic began.
